when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used as a greeting during the daytime.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (Konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when saying goodbye.
example: さようなら、またね！ (Sayounara, mata ne!) - Goodbye, see you again!

when_to_say: Used in the morning as a greeting.
example: おはよう、今日はいい天気だね！ (Ohayou, kyou wa ii tenki da ne!) - Good morning, today is nice weather!

when_to_say: Used to agree or affirm.
example: はい、わかりました！ (Hai, wakarimashita!) - Yes, I understand!

when_to_say: Used to decline or disagree.
example: いいえ、それは違います。 (Iie, sore wa chigaimasu.) - No, that's incorrect.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (Sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, could you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used when making a request.
example: お願いします、これを手伝ってください。 (Onegaishimasu, kore o tetsudatte kudasai.) - Please, help me with this.

when_to_say: Used to say you understand something.
example: はい、わかります！ (Hai, wakarimasu!) - Yes, I understand!

when_to_say: Used when you do not know something.
example: ごめんなさい、私はそれを知らないです。 (Gomen nasai, watashi wa sore o shiranai desu.) - I'm sorry, I don't know that.

when_to_say: Used when asking about a location.
example: トイレはどこですか？ (Toire wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the bathroom?

when_to_say: Used when something is not permitted or not good.
example: それはだめですよ。 (Sore wa dame desu yo.) - That's not allowed.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the current moment.
example: 今、何をしていますか？ (Ima, nani o shiteimasu ka?) - What are you doing now?

when_to_say: Used to refer to something near you.
example: これは何ですか？ (Kore wa nan desu ka?) - What is this?

when_to_say: Used to refer to something near the listener.
example: それは私の本です。 (Sore wa watashi no hon desu.) - That is my book.

when_to_say: Used to describe the size of something.
example: この車は大きいですね。 (Kono kuruma wa ookii desu ne.) - This car is big.

when_to_say: Used to describe the size of something small.
example: この箱は小さいです。 (Kono hako wa chiisai desu.) - This box is small.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed.
example: 彼は速いランナーです。 (Kare wa hayai rannā desu.) - He is a fast runner.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is slow or late.
example: 電車が遅いです。 (Densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is late.

when_to_say: Used to describe something new.
example: 新しい店が開店しました。 (Atarashii mise ga kaiten shimashita.) - A new store has opened.

when_to_say: Used to describe something old.
example: この本は古いです。 (Kono hon wa furui desu.) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe the length of something.
example: 長い髪が好きです。 (Nagai kami ga suki desu.) - I like long hair.

when_to_say: Used to describe the shortness of something.
example: 短いスカートを履いています。 (Mijikai sukāto o haiteimasu.) - She is wearing a short skirt.

when_to_say: Used to describe something visually beautiful.
example: この景色は美しいです。 (Kono keshiki wa utsukushii desu.) - This view is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe something frightening or scary.
example: この映画は怖いです。 (Kono eiga wa kowai desu.) - This movie is scary.

when_to_say: Used to describe something enjoyable or fun.
example: 今日は楽しい一日でした。 (Kyou wa tanoshii ichinichi deshita.) - Today was a fun day.

when_to_say: Used to describe something interesting or amusing.
example: この本は面白いです。 (Kono hon wa omoshiroi desu.) - This book is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to assure someone that everything is okay.
example: 大丈夫ですか？ (Daijoubu desu ka?) - Are you okay?

when_to_say: Used to describe something bad or harmful.
example: その行為は悪いです。 (Sono koui wa warui desu.) - That behavior is bad.

when_to_say: Used to describe being busy.
example: 今日は忙しいです。 (Kyou wa isogashii desu.) - I am busy today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to work or a job.
example: 私は仕事に行きます。 (Watashi wa shigoto ni ikimasu.) - I am going to work.

when_to_say: Used when referring to studying or learning.
example: 私は日本語を勉強しています。 (Watashi wa nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu.) - I am studying Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to refer to school.
example: 学校は9時に始まります。 (Gakkou wa kuji ni hajimarimasu.) - School starts at 9 o'clock.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend.
example: 私は友達と会います。 (Watashi wa tomodachi to aimasu.) - I meet with my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a house or home.
example: 私は家に帰ります。 (Watashi wa ie ni kaerimasu.) - I am going home.

when_to_say: Used when talking about eating.
example: 私は昼ごはんを食べます。 (Watashi wa hirugohan o tabemasu.) - I eat lunch.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking.
example: 私は水を飲みます。 (Watashi wa mizu o nomimasu.) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used when talking about seeing or looking at something.
example: テレビを見るのが好きです。 (Terebi o miru no ga suki desu.) - I like watching TV.

when_to_say: Used when talking about listening or asking.
example: 音楽を聞くのが好きです。 (Ongaku o kiku no ga suki desu.) - I like listening to music.

when_to_say: Used when talking about writing.
example: 私は手紙を書くのが好きです。 (Watashi wa tegami o kaku no ga suki desu.) - I like writing letters.

when_to_say: Used when referring to standing up.
example: 先生の前で立ってください。 (Sensei no mae de tatte kudasai.) - Please stand in front of the teacher.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sitting down.
example: 椅子に座ってください。 (Isu ni suwatte kudasai.) - Please sit on the chair.

when_to_say: Used when talking about sleeping.
example: 私は毎日8時間寝ます。 (Watashi wa mainichi hachi jikan nemasu.) - I sleep for 8 hours every day.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a car or automobile.
example: 私は新しい車を買いました。 (Watashi wa atarashii kuruma o kaimashita.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bicycle.
example: 私は自転車に乗ります。 (Watashi wa jitensha ni norimasu.) - I ride a bicycle.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a train.
example: 毎日電車で通勤しています。 (Mainichi densha de tsuukin shiteimasu.) - I commute by train every day.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an airplane.
example: 飛行機で旅行します。 (Hikouki de ryokou shimasu.) - I travel by airplane.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a ship or boat.
example: 船で海を渡ります。 (Fune de umi o watarimasu.) - I cross the sea by boat.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a road or street.
example: この道をまっすぐ行きます。 (Kono michi o massugu ikimasu.) - Go straight down this road.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an intersection or crossroad.
example: 交差点で右に曲がります。 (Kousaten de migi ni magarimasu.) - Turn right at the intersection.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a traffic light.
example: 信号が赤です。 (Shingou ga aka desu.) - The traffic light is red.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an airport.
example: 空港に到着しました。 (Kuukou ni touchakushimashita.) - I arrived at the airport.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a station (train or bus).
example: 駅に着きました。 (Eki ni tsukimashita.) - I arrived at the station.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bus.
example: 私はバスで学校に行きます。 (Watashi wa basu de gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school by bus.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a taxi.
example: タクシーを呼んでください。 (Takushii o yonde kudasai.) - Please call a taxi.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a map.
example: 地図を見てください。 (Chizu o mite kudasai.) - Please look at the map.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a hotel.
example: ホテルに泊まります。 (Hoteru ni tomarimasu.) - I will stay at the hotel.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a restaurant.
example: このレストランは美味しいです。 (Kono resutoran wa oishii desu.) - This restaurant is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that tastes good.
example: このケーキは美味しいです。 (Kono keeki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that costs a lot or something that is high.
example: この時計は高いです。 (Kono tokei wa takai desu.) - This watch is expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is affordable or low in price.
example: このシャツは安いです。 (Kono shatsu wa yasui desu.) - This shirt is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe something or someone that is fast or quick.
example: 彼は走るのが早いです。 (Kare wa hashiru no ga hayai desu.) - He runs fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe something or someone that is slow or late.
example: バスが遅いです。 (Basu ga osoi desu.) - The bus is late.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is new.
example: 新しいパソコンを買いました。 (Atarashii pasokon o kaimashita.) - I bought a new computer.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is old.
example: この本は古いです。 (Kono hon wa furui desu.) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather.
example: 今日は暑いです。 (Kyou wa atsui desu.) - Today is hot.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 外は寒いです。 (Soto wa samui desu.) - It is cold outside.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is fun or enjoyable.
example: このパーティーは楽しいです。 (Kono paatii wa tanoshii desu.) - This party is fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe feelings of sadness.
example: 彼女は悲しいです。 (Kanojo wa kanashii desu.) - She is sad.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is interesting or fun.
example: この映画は面白いです。 (Kono eiga wa omoshiroi desu.) - This movie is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is difficult.
example: この問題は難しいです。 (Kono mondai wa muzukashii desu.) - This problem is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is simple or easy.
example: この問題は簡単です。 (Kono mondai wa kantan desu.) - This problem is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is wide or spacious.
example: この部屋は広いです。 (Kono heya wa hiroi desu.) - This room is spacious.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is narrow or cramped.
example: この部屋は狭いです。 (Kono heya wa semai desu.) - This room is cramped.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the country Japan.
example: 私は日本に行きたいです。 (Watashi wa Nihon ni ikitai desu.) - I want to go to Japan.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the country America.
example: アメリカは大きな国です。 (Amerika wa ookina kuni desu.) - America is a big country.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a school.
example: 私は毎日学校に行きます。 (Watashi wa mainichi gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school every day.

when_to_say: Used to address or refer to a teacher.
example: 先生は親切です。 (Sensei wa shinsetsu desu.) - The teacher is kind.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a student.
example: 私は学生です。 (Watashi wa gakusei desu.) - I am a student.

when_to_say: Used to refer to work or a job.
example: 私は仕事があります。 (Watashi wa shigoto ga arimasu.) - I have a job.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend.
example: 彼は私の友達です。 (Kare wa watashi no tomodachi desu.) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a family.
example: 私の家族は4人です。 (Watashi no kazoku wa yonin desu.) - My family is four people.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a car.
example: 私は車を持っています。 (Watashi wa kuruma o motteimasu.) - I have a car.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bicycle.
example: 私は自転車に乗っています。 (Watashi wa jitensha ni notteimasu.) - I am riding a bicycle.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a telephone or phone.
example: 私は電話をかけます。 (Watashi wa denwa o kakemasu.) - I will make a phone call.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a television.
example: 私はテレビを見るのが好きです。 (Watashi wa terebi o miru no ga suki desu.) - I like watching TV.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a movie.
example: 映画を見に行きましょう。 (Eiga o mi ni ikimashou.) - Let's go watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used to refer to music.
example: 私は音楽を聴くのが好きです。 (Watashi wa ongaku o kiku no ga suki desu.) - I like listening to music.

when_to_say: Used to refer to sports.
example: 私はスポーツが得意です。 (Watashi wa supootsu ga tokui desu.) - I am good at sports.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a trip or travel.
example: 旅行が大好きです。 (Ryokou ga daisuki desu.) - I love traveling.

when_to_say: Used to refer to food in general.
example: 食べ物を買いに行きましょう。 (Tabemono o kai ni ikimashou.) - Let's go buy food.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water.
example: 私は水が欲しいです。 (Watashi wa mizu ga hoshii desu.) - I want water.

when_to_say: Used to refer to tea.
example: お茶を飲みませんか？ (Ocha o nomimasen ka?) - Would you like to drink tea?

when_to_say: Used to refer to coffee.
example: コーヒーを一杯ください。 (Koohii o ippai kudasai.) - Please give me a cup of coffee.

when_to_say: Used to refer to meat.
example: 私は肉が好きです。 (Watashi wa niku ga suki desu.) - I like meat.

when_to_say: Used to refer to fish.
example: 魚を食べましょう。 (Sakana o tabemashou.) - Let's eat fish.

when_to_say: Used to refer to vegetables.
example: 私は野菜が好きではありません。 (Watashi wa yasai ga suki de wa arimasen.) - I don't like vegetables.

when_to_say: Used to refer to fruit.
example: 果物を食べるのが好きです。 (Kudamono o taberu no ga suki desu.) - I like eating fruits.

when_to_say: Used to describe something sweet.
example: このケーキはとても甘いです。 (Kono keeki wa totemo amai desu.) - This cake is very sweet.

when_to_say: Used to describe something spicy.
example: この料理は辛いです。 (Kono ryouri wa karai desu.) - This dish is spicy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something cold to the touch.
example: この水は冷たいです。 (Kono mizu wa tsumetai desu.) - This water is cold.

when_to_say: Used to describe something warm to the touch.
example: このお茶は温かいです。 (Kono ocha wa atatakai desu.) - This tea is warm.

when_to_say: Used to describe something delicious.
example: この寿司はおいしいです。 (Kono sushi wa oishii desu.) - This sushi is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe something with a bad taste.
example: この料理はまずいです。 (Kono ryouri wa mazui desu.) - This dish tastes bad.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a drink.
example: 私は飲み物を注文します。 (Watashi wa nomimono o chuumon shimasu.) - I will order a drink.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a store or shop.
example: この店はとても人気があります。 (Kono mise wa totemo ninki ga arimasu.) - This store is very popular.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a train station.
example: 駅で待ち合わせましょう。 (Eki de machiawase mashou.) - Let's meet at the station.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an airport.
example: 空港は遠いです。 (Kuukou wa tooi desu.) - The airport is far.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a road or street.
example: この道はとても狭いです。 (Kono michi wa totemo semai desu.) - This road is very narrow.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a traffic signal.
example: 信号が赤です。 (Shingou ga aka desu.) - The traffic light is red.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the left direction.
example: 左に曲がってください。 (Hidari ni magatte kudasai.) - Please turn left.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the right direction.
example: 右に行ってください。 (Migi ni itte kudasai.) - Please go right.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the front or ahead.
example: 前に進んでください。 (Mae ni susunde kudasai.) - Please move forward.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the back or behind.
example: 後ろに立たないでください。 (Ushiro ni tatanai de kudasai.) - Please do not stand behind.

when_to_say: Used to refer to inside or the middle of something.
example: バッグの中にあります。 (Baggu no naka ni arimasu.) - It's inside the bag.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the outside.
example: 外で待っています。 (Soto de matteimasu.) - I am waiting outside.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is near.
example: 駅はすぐ近いです。 (Eki wa sugu chikai desu.) - The station is very close.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is far away.
example: 学校は遠いです。 (Gakkou wa tooi desu.) - The school is far.

when_to_say: Used when asking for or giving directions.
example: 道順を教えてください。 (Michijun o oshiete kudasai.) - Please tell me the directions.

when_to_say: Used to indicate a left turn.
example: ここで左折してください。 (Koko de sasei shite kudasai.) - Please turn left here.

when_to_say: Used to refer to cooking or cuisine in general.
example: 日本料理が好きです。 (Nihon ryouri ga suki desu.) - I like Japanese cuisine.

when_to_say: Used when talking about eating something.
example: 朝ごはんを食べました。 (Asagohan o tabemashita.) - I ate breakfast.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking something.
example: 水を飲んでいます。 (Mizu o nondeimasu.) - I am drinking water.

when_to_say: Used to describe food that tastes good.
example: このケーキはおいしいです。 (Kono keeki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to express dislike for something.
example: 私は辛い食べ物が嫌いです。 (Watashi wa karai tabemono ga kirai desu.) - I dislike spicy food.

when_to_say: Used to express liking or love for something.
example: 私は寿司が好きです。 (Watashi wa sushi ga suki desu.) - I like sushi.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is new.
example: 新しい車を買いました。 (Atarashii kuruma o kaimashita.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is old.
example: この本は古いです。 (Kono hon wa furui desu.) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is high or expensive.
example: この時計は高いです。 (Kono tokei wa takai desu.) - This watch is expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is inexpensive or cheap.
example: この店は安いです。 (Kono mise wa yasui desu.) - This store is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is fast or quick.
example: 彼は走るのが早いです。 (Kare wa hashiru no ga hayai desu.) - He is fast at running.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is slow or late.
example: 電車が遅いです。 (Densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is late.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is fun or enjoyable.
example: 今日のパーティーは楽しいです。 (Kyou no paatii wa tanoshii desu.) - Today's party is fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is boring or dull.
example: その映画はつまらないです。 (Sono eiga wa tsumaranai desu.) - That movie is boring.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is bright or cheerful.
example: 彼女は明るい人です。 (Kanojo wa akarui hito desu.) - She is a cheerful person.

when_to_say: Used when talking about the next day.
example: 明日は忙しいです。 (Ashita wa isogashii desu.) - Tomorrow is busy.

when_to_say: Used when talking about the previous day.
example: 昨日は何もできませんでした。 (Kinou wa nanimo dekimasen deshita.) - I couldn't do anything yesterday.

when_to_say: Used when talking about the current day.
example: 今日はいい天気ですね。 (Kyou wa ii tenki desu ne.) - The weather is nice today.

when_to_say: Used when talking about time or duration.
example: 今は何時ですか？ (Ima wa nanji desu ka?) - What time is it now?

when_to_say: Used to indicate minutes in time.
example: 5分後に出発します。 (Go-fun go ni shuppatsu shimasu.) - I will leave in 5 minutes.

when_to_say: Used to indicate seconds in time.
example: 3秒ですぐに終わります。 (San-byou de sugu ni owarimasu.) - It will finish in 3 seconds.

when_to_say: Used when talking about the previous week.
example: 先週は忙しかったです。 (Senshuu wa isogashikatta desu.) - I was busy last week.

when_to_say: Used when talking about the upcoming week.
example: 来週は旅行に行きます。 (Raishuu wa ryokou ni ikimasu.) - I will go on a trip next week.

when_to_say: Used when talking about Monday.
example: 月曜日は仕事です。 (Getsuyoubi wa shigoto desu.) - Monday is workday.

when_to_say: Used when talking about Tuesday.
example: 火曜日に会議があります。 (Kayoubi ni kaigi ga arimasu.) - There is a meeting on Tuesday.

when_to_say: Used when talking about Wednesday.
example: 水曜日は休みです。 (Suiyoubi wa yasumi desu.) - Wednesday is a holiday.

when_to_say: Used when talking about Thursday.
example: 木曜日に友達と会います。 (Mokuyoubi ni tomodachi to aimasu.) - I will meet my friend on Thursday.

when_to_say: Used when talking about Friday.
example: 金曜日は仕事が終わったら飲みに行きます。 (Kinyoubi wa shigoto ga owattara nomi ni ikimasu.) - I will go for drinks after work on Friday.

when_to_say: Used when talking about Saturday.
example: 土曜日は休息の日です。 (Doyoubi wa kyūsoku no hi desu.) - Saturday is a day to rest.

when_to_say: Used when talking about Sunday.
example: 日曜日に家族と一緒に過ごします。 (Nichiyoubi ni kazoku to issho ni sugoshimasu.) - I spend Sunday with my family.
